edu.northwestern.at.utils.corpuslinguistics.inflector.wordrule
Class SuffixInflectionRule

java.lang.Object
  edu.northwestern.at.utils.corpuslinguistics.inflector.wordrule.SuffixInflectionRule
All Implemented Interfaces:
WordRule
Direct Known Subclasses:
CategoryInflectionRule
public class SuffixInflectionRule
extends java.lang.Object
implements WordRule

A rule for specifying an inflection using suffixes.

For example, the English nouns which have the suffix -y, generally change the suffix to -ies in the plural. Such a rule would be expressed as new SuffixInflectionRule("-y", "-ies").

Original code written by Tom White under the Apache v2 license. Modified by Philip R. Burns for integration into MorphAdorner.

Constructor Detail

SuffixInflectionRule

public SuffixInflectionRule(java.lang.String singularSuffix,
                            java.lang.String pluralSuffix)
Construct a rule for a suffix singularSuffix which becomes pluralSuffix in the plural.

Parameters:
singularSuffix - The singular suffix, starting with a "-" character.
pluralSuffix - The plural suffix, starting with a "-" character.

SuffixInflectionRule

public SuffixInflectionRule(java.lang.String suffix,
                            java.lang.String singularSuffix,
                            java.lang.String pluralSuffix)
Construct a rule for words with suffix suffix, where singularSuffix becomes pluralSuffix in the plural.

Parameters:
suffix - The suffix, starting with a "-" character, which the end of the word must match. Regular expression patterns may be used.
singularSuffix - The singular suffix, starting with a "-" character. The suffix must end with singularSuffix.
pluralSuffix - The plural suffix, starting with a "-" character.
